newsitem.title: USA: Northwest Natural Gas, union announce deal.
newsitem.headline: Northwest Natural Gas, union announce deal.

text.p: Northwest Natural Gas Co has reached a seven-year labor agreement with the union that represents about 75 percent of company employees, a spokesman for the utility said on Friday.
The agreement with Local 11 of the Office and Professional Employees International Union was announced Thursday at the company's annual shareholders meeting.
The so-called Joint Accord, which continues an arrangement in effect since 1989, was approved by 87 percent of the local union membership and took effect April 1.
The deal includes annual pay increases of 3.25 percent that can rise as high as 8 percent in later years of the contract depending on inflation, company spokesman Doug Yocom said.
The contract also includes profit-sharing bonuses that can range as high as seven percent of annual salary, up from the current maximum of 5.5 percent.
